meanings.definition: A grotesque or bizarre gesture, pose, or trick.
meanings.sent1: The clown's antick made everyone laugh at the circus.
meanings.sent2: She twisted her body into an antick to entertain the children.
meanings.sent3: The antick he made with his face scared the little girl.
meanings.sent4: Her dance was an antick that mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: The antick he performed was so strange, it stuck in everyone's memory.

meanings.sent1: The antick at the party had a red nose and big shoes.
meanings.sent2: The children giggled at the silly antick's jokes.
meanings.sent3: The antick's colorful costume brightened up the room.
meanings.sent4: He played the role of the antick with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The antick's performance brought joy to all who watched.

meanings.definition: To perform antics or clownish behavior.
meanings.sent1: The children love to antick around the playground.
meanings.sent2: She would often antick to make her friends laugh.
meanings.sent3: He decided to antick his way through the talent show.
meanings.sent4: The comedian would antick on stage to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent5: They would antick together, creating a fun atmosphere wherever they went.
